required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AGN-229666 for the Treatment of Allergic Conjunctivitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of AGN-229666 for the treatment of allergic conjunctivitis.

primary_outcome.description: The participant evaluated ocular itching in both eyes 5 minutes post conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) (8 hours post-dose) at Day 1 using a 9-point scale in half-unit increments where: 0=none to 4=incapacitating itch with an irresistible urge to rub. The score for each participant was the average of the score of both eyes.

secondary_outcome.description: The participant evaluated ocular itching in both eyes 5 minutes post conjunctival allergen challenge (16 hours post-dose) at Day 15 using a 9-point scale in half-unit increments where: 0=none to 4=incapacitating itch with an irresistible urge to rub. The score for each participant was the average of the score of both eyes.

Conjunctival hyperemia is the engorgement of the blood vessels (redness) of the clear membrane covering the white surface of the eye. Conjunctival hyperemia was evaluated 15 minutes post conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) (8 hours post dose) on Day 1 for both eyes using a 9-point scale in half-unit increments where: 0=none to 4=Extremely severe. The score for each participant was the average of the score of both eyes.

arm_group.description: One drop of AGN-229666 Dose A into each eye on Day 1 and Day 15.
One drop of AGN-229666 Dose B into each eye on Day 1 and Day 15.
One drop of vehicle of AGN-229666 into each eye on Day 1 and Day 15.

intervention.description: One drop of AGN-229666 into each eye on Day 1 and Day 15.
One drop of vehicle of AGN-229666 into each eye on Day 1 and Day 15.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Japanese patients living in Japan with a history of allergic conjunctivitis
- Willing to discontinue wearing contact lenses during the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of nicotine products during the study period
- Presence of active eye infection (bacterial, viral, or fungal)
- History of an ocular herpetic infection
- Eye surgery intervention within 3 months and/or a history of refractive surgery within the past 6 months

outcome.title: Ocular Itching Score at Day 1
outcome.description: The participant evaluated ocular itching in both eyes 5 minutes post conjunctival allergen challenge (CAC) (8 hours post-dose) at Day 1 using a 9-point scale in half-unit increments where: 0=none to 4=incapacitating itch with an irresistible urge to rub. The score for each participant was the average of the score of both eyes.
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (MITT) population included all randomized participants with ocular itching score data available for this time point

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
